alert.note: Alert for Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:43AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Raleigh and southeastern Fayette Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 543 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Piney View, or 7 miles northeast of Beckley, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Rainelle, Bradley, Piney View, Stanaford, Daniels, Beaver, Shady Spring and Meadow Bridge. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 124 and 137. Route 19 between mile markers 2 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
